results.title: [Royal guest XVI Olympiad 1956]
results.brief_description: A historical record of Prince Philip’s visit to Melbourne during the 1956 Olympic Games. Captures his airport arrival; the public lining Melbourne’s streets to greet the Prince; his visit to Government House; a parade on Swanston street showing a glimpse of Melbourne Town Hall; the opening ceremony at Olympic Games; Robert Menzies and Prince Philip arriving at the Olympic stadium; entrance of athletes at the opening ceremony; Ron Clarke’s memorable entrance into the stadium and the lighting of the Olympic flame; footage of Station Pier in Port Melbourne; Philip arriving at St Paul’s cathedral in Melbourne; an extensive tour of the accomodation facilities prepared for the athletes at Olympic Village in Heidelberg; Philip visit a hospital and the Australian Paper Manufacturers mill in Heidelberg; shows footage of various track and field events in the stadium; a ceremony at Melbourne’s Shrine of Rememberance; the departure of Prince Philip.

results.title: Shelter
results.creator_credit: Malcolm Wallhead and Vagabond Motion Picture Film Production Unit
results.brief_description:
A disturbed young man, frightened by the threat of nuclear war, wanders the streets in search of safety.

The film was shot on the city streets of Perth, Western Australia.

results.title: Tullamarine project [original cut]
results.brief_description: A crowd waves goodbye to a T.A.A. flight at Essendon Airport, aerial shots of the City of Melbourne and Yarra River. late developmental stages of construction on the Tullamarine Airport and Freeway. Shot in October 1968.

results.title: Hawkins' rivers
results.creator_credit: Robert Heazlewood, TAS Television Productions and Eyelevel Production
results.brief_description: Leo McKern narrates this modern day adventure set in twentieth century Tasmania. The true story concerns Tasmanian doctor and canoeist John Hawkins, who led the fight to save the Franklin River. It was, and still is a dilemma between developing the natural resources of the land or to forgo development at the price of suffering potential economic, political and social consequences. It is an issue that commanded the rest of the nation’s attention and continues to be pertinent today.

results.title: Ray of hope
results.creator_credit: Jack Rogers, Maslyn Williams and Australian National Film Board
results.brief_description: Designed for use in a national campaign against tuberculosis, this film describes the disease and preventive measures being taken to eradicate the disease from Australia. Shows the use of chest X-ray in detecting the disease; symptoms, nature and spread of tuberculosis; treatment of patients at sanatorium; importance of keeping children free from infection; use of BCG vaccine for the immunization of school children.

results.title: Postcard from Perth
results.creator_credit: Shan Benson, Eric Thompson and Australian National Film Board
results.brief_description: Perth, far removed from the main centres of Austraian life and industry, is a quiet and peaceful city [1954]. Folks relax and do not seem to hurry. This film reflects somewhat, the leisure and and activities of the people of Perth in the 1950s.

results.title: The Marist way
results.brief_description: Locally produced documentary promoting the virtues of the monastic life, and teaching methods practise by the Marist Order. The film details the rigorous regime of scholastic, spiritual and athletic training the Brothers apply to their words in boarding schools across Australia. In conclusion, it asks which of their charges will assume their monastic vocation.

results.title: The New Ipswich
results.creator_credit: Eric Thompson and Australian news and Information Bureau
results.brief_description: The story of the way of life of the people in Ipswich, Queensland. Scenes include: the Alan Cunnigham memorial (explorer) railway workshop, woollen mill, timber mill and coal mines, schools and leisure activities. Music by Robert Hughes.
